thread.title: National Weather Service forecasts perfect El Paso weather for Sun Bowl
thread.title_full: National Weather Service forecasts perfect El Paso weather for Sun Bowl

author: Aaron A. Bedoya
title: National Weather Service forecasts perfect El Paso weather for Sun Bowl
text: [Aaron A. Bedoya](/staff/4406959002/aaron-a-bedoya/) Football enthusiasts gearing up for [today's Sun Bowl](/story/sports/football/2023/12/27/sun-bowl-teams-tickets-parking-bowl-game-matchup/71813673007/) can anticipate picture-perfect weather conditions, setting the stage for a great game between Notre Dame and Oregon State. As fans prepare to cheer on their favorite teams, the forecast promises a blend of sunshine, seasonal temperatures, and gentle breezes, according to the National Weather Service. The weather report for the Sun Bowl Stadium indicates a temperature range of 50-55 degrees Fahrenheit, according to the National Weather Service. While the sun will dominate the skies, creating a scenic backdrop for the game, attendees are advised to dress warmly, especially those occupying shady spots, where temperatures may lean towards the cooler side. More: [Updated list of Notre Dame, Oregon State players to opt out of Tony the Tiger Sun Bowl](/story/sports/college/sunbowl/2023/12/29/sun-bowl-opt-outs-details-on-notre-dame-oregon-state-players/72056913007/) Whether you're a die-hard supporter or a casual spectator, today's conditions at the Sun Bowl promise a comfortable and enjoyable experience. So, don your team colors, grab snacks and prepare for an exhilarating football afternoon in El Paso.
